bibl.title: Jewelry and Accessories from two Christian Burials from Fag el Gamous Cemetery in Fayum Region, Egypt.
bibl.note: Dig concession of Brigham Young University since 1982. Burial #44 was discovered during the 2006 dig season; #13 was uncovered in 2003 and analyzed during the 2007 dig season. - 1. Introduction. - 2. Bells and shells. - 3. The ivory beads. - 4. Faience beads of burial #44. - 5. A brief summary of faience history, symbolism, and production technology. - 6. Glass history and production processes. - 7. The glass beads of burial #44. - 8. The second burial for consideration, #13.

bibl.title: assisted by Elisabeth Ehler, Dress Accessories of the 1st Millennium AD from Egypt. Proceedings of the 6th Conference of the Research Group 'Textiles from the Nile Valley', Antwerp, 2-3 October 2009.

bibl.seg: Smith Joyce Y., Kristin South, C. Wilfred Griggs and Giovanni Tata, Jewelry and Accessories from two Christian Burials from Fag el Gamous Cemetery in Fayum Region, Egypt.

Antoine De Moor and CÃ¤cilia Fluck (Edd.), assisted by Elisabeth Ehler, Dress Accessories of the 1st Millennium AD from Egypt. Proceedings of the 6th Conference of the Research Group 'Textiles from the Nile Valley', Antwerp, 2-3 October 2009 (Tielt, 2011) pp. 204-219, 11 figg. coul.

Dig concession of Brigham Young University since 1982. Burial #44 was discovered during the 2006 dig season; #13 was uncovered in 2003 and analyzed during the 2007 dig season. - 1. Introduction. - 2. Bells and shells. - 3. The ivory beads. - 4. Faience beads of burial #44. - 5. A brief summary of faience history, symbolism, and production technology. - 6.
